reviews.text: I enjoyed staying in this hotel for 1 week in July 2010. Everything worked well. The staff was generally courteous and helpful especially the front desk staff and the room attendants. If I have to find fault, the breakfast staff probably need to smile a little bit more - almost all of them looked aloof and long faced throughout my stay. I used the gym once and found it to be well equipped. My room was quiet. I didn't eat in the restaurants except breakfast. I arrived at midnight and had to order room service. Because of the 24 euro which I paid for a sandwich - a very high price for a sandwich anywhere - I had decided to eat out for the rest of my stay. There was a Chinese restaurant one street away that charged 7.50 euro for a good spread of buffet lunch and dinner. Next door to the restaurant was a gourmet hamburger bar that also served other western dishes at very reasonable price. There was also a shopping complex with a supermarket close by.
reviews.title: A real 5 stars hotel at a reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location wise, the hotel was close to 2 Metro underground stations, and was handy to anywhere.
reviews.title: Very Nice Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will definitely come back again.
reviews.title: Worth of money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Real Palacio is a 5 Star Hotel is Lisbon - and was worth every Euro. Great rooms, kept very clean. Air conditioning works well, excellent water pressure, great location - right near the Parque Station for the Metro - which in turn will take you to the Baixa area in about 5 minutes. Of particular note is the excellent service provided by the front desk staff. They were willing to take the time and show us good locations with a map, describe in perfect detail how to get there and what to see. In particular we were advised to go to a particular restaurant in Belem which was just incredible - Pasteis de Belem. All spoke excellent English. Breakfast included the standard American style buffet and European style breakfast - all very good. Internet service was very fast and always available at their business center (no extra charge). In summation I would go back here in a second.
reviews.title: Efficient, clean and friendly: perfect for a no-fuss holiday

reviews.text: Hotel is located about 3km from city central (from party center I mean) but 3 metro(=subway) lines, several bus lines inside on 300 mtr radius and Lisbon cheap taxies takes this VERY nice hotel near city center.
reviews.title: Very good service at a very good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for one night in October. It's a nice place, large room, free internet, free use of jacuzzi, pleasant breakfast. The location is close to the centre but a bit of a walk from the tube which makes it feel like a bit of the distance. I'd agree with others that it doesn't quite feel like a 5*. There's a little bit of luxury missing from the room. The bed was quite hard and furnishings fairly basic and comparable to 3/4* hotels that I have stayed in.
reviews.title: Nice but could be better

reviews.text: We have been revisiting Lisbon and Real Palacio :-)
reviews.title: Revisit to Lisbon and hotel Real Palacio :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As always it was a pleasure!
reviews.title: Wrong star but a nice hotel.

reviews.text: The staff was as welcoming and service minded as the last time we visited :-)
reviews.title: Great Value but NOT 5 Star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights this time as we spent the rest of our 1 week of holiday in one of the Real hotels in Albufeira.
reviews.title: Overbooking
Super Hotel mit guter Lage
reviews.text: hotel was very nice, staff very friendly and the breakfast was very good. breakfast room was without window.
the rooms are clean and the towels were changed every day.
reviews.title: A great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: at first we had a standard room, in which the toilet was broken, we spoke with the reception and they gave us a superior room with terasse and to a silent street. very good.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but not what expected from a 5*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed there for three nights. the rooms (even the standard room) are big and well furnished.
reviews.title: Highly recommended - great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a quiet area away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre, though conveniently placed near to a tube station and some small restaurants. The interior is attractive and spotlessly clean, as were the rooms themselves which were also a decent size. The only negative point regarding the rooms is that the beds are quite hard. Breakfast is excellent though with a wide range of pastries, fruit, meats, cheeses, salmon, cereals and lovely pankakes with maple syrup or chocolate sauce.
reviews.title: Quality Hotel

reviews.text: My friends and I stayed at Real Palacio for 5 nights and I can't say enough about how great the hotel, its staff, and its food (breakfast included in the room price) are. The staff were available to answer all of our questions about things to do in Lisbon at a moment's notice and the rooms were quite nice (we even got turn down service with a chocolate on our bed every night). The hotel is about a 5 minute walk to the blue/red line metro station and there is even good shopping closeby the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and stay there on a future trip to Lisbon.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel - great value and staff
Highly Recommended,Very Nice,and close to centre via Metro
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights over Easter Weekend.Booked via Hotels.com @ 110 euro a night. Emailed ahead to hotel to request quiet room on high floor to avoid Street niose and received very nice and very spacious room on top floor with a terrace.Parque Metro station is 5 minutes walk from Hotel. A further 5 to 10 mins will have you in city centre.Trains every couple of minutes.Very easy to reach from Airport,Aero bus or bus 745 stop at end of street. Get off at Picoas Metro station.Would definitelt stay again
Our trip was 2 weeks long and it included 3 cities - Barceona, Lisbon and Madrid.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, the highlight of our trip to Lisbon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of the three cities, the stay at Real Palacios constituted the absolute highlight!
reviews.title: Very very nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were beautiful, the service impeccable, the restaurant food excellent and the price obtained through booking.com incredibly low in comparison to the real price (a night costs 300 euros, we paid 80!!!)
reviews.title: still ok but dissapointing
